intro: Streptanthus amplexicaulis var. barbarae, commonly known as the Barbra's clasping jewelflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountains of California. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations, often in open meadows or along stream banks. Its leaves are clasping, forming a tight rosette around the stem, and it produces elongated pods that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
